column4: I'm trying to get my swap file on my swap partition... I'm using a howto. It said "dd if=/dev/zero of=/swapfile1 bs=1024 count=524288" would create it but I don't know where it has gone?
free -m "Swap:            0          0          0" >:o
hey, I have the same problem!!!
What are you trying to do?
you mean, how am I going to fix it?
yeah that as well. I wanted to get it working in the first place so I could hibernate
do you have multiple OSs installed?  like 2 ubuntus?
Windows + Ubuntu
well, try sudo swapon -a       see if you get any errors
Where abouts?
on a terminal, the same place you ran free
I'm lost. I don't know where the swap file is going when I create it with  dd if=/dev/zero of=/swapfile1
nothing happens when I try swapon -a
oh, you are using a swap file, sorry cant help!   try asking ubottu for help, with !swap
what were you thinking?
that you were using a swap partition
I thought I needed to have a swap partition to hibernate and that the swap file would be on that partition. Linux doesn't seem to be using that partition
no, if you have a swap partition, then linux just used the whole partition, no files needed.  Using a swap file would be creating a file on your regular partition, and using that file for swap space
ok. So how do I delete the file I created and get uswsusp to use that swap partition?
can you pastebin sudo fdisk -l        and ls -al /dev/disk/bu-uuid/           and the contents of /etc/fstab
woops, its ls -al /dev/disk/by-uuid/
http://pastebin.com/d377a9b7b
